Lyric:
[by:hondoes]
[00:09.54]When I was six years old I broke my leg
[00:16.66]I was running from my brother and his friends
[00:23.67]And tasted the sweet perfume of the mountain grass I rolled down
[00:30.95]I was younger then, take me back to when I
[00:37.35]
[00:38.22]Found my heart and broke it here
[00:41.35]Made friends and lost them through the years
[00:45.37]And I've not seen the roaring fields in so long, I know I've grown
[00:52.63]But I can't wait to go home
[00:55.31]
[00:55.57]I'm on my way
[00:59.14]Driving at 90 down those country lanes
[01:06.36]Singing to "Tiny Dancer"
[01:09.53]And I miss the way you make me feel, and it's real
[01:16.90]We watched the sunset over the castle on the hill
[01:24.35]
[01:59.83]Over the castle on the hill
[02:07.00]Over the castle on the hill
[02:14.06]Over the castle on the hill
[02:28.52]Over the castle on the hill
[02:32.26]
[02:46.48]And I'm on my way, I still remember
[02:53.06]These old country lanes
[02:56.91]When we did not know the answers
[03:00.76]And I miss the way you make me feel, it's real
[03:07.98]We watched the sunset over the castle on the hill
